title: Joaquin Phoenix improvised climbing into refrigerator in Joker film
text:
Joaquin Phoenix improvised climbing into a fridge during a shocking scene in Joker.

The actor's on-screen brilliance was lauded by the movie's cinematographer Lawrence Sher, who claimed that the 44-year-old left crew members in awe after spontaneously climbing into a fridge.

Revealing that Joaquin took on-board what a 'massive insomniac' would do, Lawrence explained to Slash Film: 'When he climbed in the refrigerator, we had no idea he was going to do that.'

'Did he just crawl in the fridge?' Joaquin Phoenix, 44, stunned crew member after he improvised climbing into a fridge during a shocking scene in Joker.

Giving further behind the scenes context into the eerie scene, which saw Joaquin, who plays Arthur Fleck, cleaning out the fridge while a voicemail of an inquisitive detective plays in the background, Lawrence continued:

'We set up two camera positions, and Joaquin just thought about what he would do if he was a massive insomniac.

'Again, we lit it so he could go anywhere, and the first and only time he did it, we were mesmerised. I remember thinking, "What is he doing? Did he just crawl in the fridge?"

'It was as fun and weird for us to watch it too,' he added.

The film stars Joaquin as the man who becomes Batman's classic nemesis in the original story film.

Despite the best October opening with $80.3 million, Joker has come under intense scrutiny due to its 'glorification' of gun violence,

Both Phoenix and director Todd Phillips have defended the film, with the actor saying he trusts audiences to know the difference between right and wrong.

Plot: The film stars Joaquin as the man who becomes Batman's classic nemesis in the original story film

Phillips recently revealed he was surprised by the criticism of Joker because he took measures to instil 'real-world implications' of violence not often found in cartoon films and television shows.

Despite receiving critical acclaim, social media monitoring FBI agents in the US have warned it could inspire screening attacks from incels - a term which refers to men who are 'involuntarily celibate' and blame their situation on women.

The film took home the Golden Lion, the top prize at the Venice Film Festival

Joker currently holds a 69 percent fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes from critics, while audiences have given it a collective 89%.
